titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Records of the Virginia Dept. of Alcoholic Beverage Control, 1934-1999
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 53305

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Records of the Virginia Dept. of Alcoholic Beverage Control, 1934-1999
did.origination: Virginia. Dept. of Alcoholic Beverage Control.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Dept. of Alcoholic Beverage Control, Records, 1934-1999. Accession 53305. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority, 17 May 2021.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection has been processed using minimal processing standards. The original arrangement has been maintained, the container list is brief and simple, and the records have not been refoldered and fasteners have not been removed.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Alcoholic Beverage Control Board and its administrative arm, the Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control, were created by an act of the General Assembly passed on March 7, 1934. The act, known as the Alcoholic Beverage Control Act, which the department was established to administer, specified the circumstances under which alcoholic beverages could be purchased and consumed. The act has been amended over the years. A major change occurred on February 7, 1968, when the General Assembly approved the sale of mixed drinks on a local option basis. The Board has three members appointed by the governor and confirmed by the General Assembly. It establishes rules and policies governing the Department, which controls through licenses and permits, the manufacture, bottling, selling, advertising, and transporting of alcoholic beverages; operates state stores for the sale of beverages, other than beer, to consumers and licensees. The Commissioner operates out of the Richmond office, with district offices established in Abingdon, Alexandria, Charlottesville, Chesapeake, Hampton, Lynchburg, Roanoke, and Staunton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1934-1999, including codes, legislation, orders, studies, and regulations of the Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Board. Topics include store hours, hearings, alcoholism, budgets, underage drinking, town meetings, and law enforcement, among others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series IV: Virginia Codes and Regulations, 1968-1998
